Salad Party may not be what comes to mind when you think about fourth grade fun but at Rock Creek Community Academy, that's exactly the sort of fun we like to cultivate! Our fourth grade classes have spent five and a half weeks learning about nutrition and wellness. During this time, students have planted a hydroponic garden and observed the growth of the plants. Our first measurement for Plant A was 9 mm. Today, the plant measured over 200 mm!
Families sent in a variety of toppings for our salads. Students were challenged to try one thing they've never tasted and try a different salad dressing. They took on this challenge and exceeded it. Kids went and harvested lettuce for seconds, thirds, even fourth servings!
We are thankful Mr. Dixon made this opportunity possible. This experience was outstanding! Watch and see what we grow next. üå± ü¶Å Erica Beyl

We wanted to share a little bit about what is going on in fourth grade at Rock Creek Community Academy. We just completed Hoosier Hysteria and created a wax museum to showcase our efforts to our school and community.

Hoosier Hysteria is a multi genre project fourth graders complete each year here at RCCA. Anticipation can be felt from the beginning when the student picks out his or her famous Hoosier all the way until he or she dresses up as the individual and gives a two to five minutes speech for students, staff members, and families. During this project, students write a research paper, create a timeline, write and memorize a speech, create a display and then finally present their Hoosier in a wax museum style showcase. This is a highly challenging but rewarding project that pushes even the shyest fourth grader to step up and show what he or she knows!

Sincerely,
Mrs. Lovins
&
Mrs. Beyl
